newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-DEPORTIVO BEAT BETIS TO GO TOP IN SPAIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-DEPORTIVO BEAT BETIS TO GO TOP IN SPAIN.

text.p: Deportivo Coruna replaced Real Betis at the top of the Spanish first division on Saturday, recovering from a goal down to beat the leaders 2-1.
With 11 points from five games, Deportivo go one point ahead of Betis and third-placed Barcelona, who play on Sunday.
Croatian midfielder Robert Jarni put Betis ahead after just two minutes when he left Deportivo keeper Jacques Songo'o standing with a superbly curled free-kick.
But after a strong start Betis seemed to relax and the game became scrappy with the referee failing to clamp down on some heavy challenges.
With former Ajax man Finidi George in fine form down the right wing, Betis had most of the play in the the second half.

But sloppy marking let in Frenchman Mickael Madar to set up Brazilian forward Rivaldo for a simple equaliser 20 minutes from time and the visitors went home with three points after Madar was allowed a free header 10 minutes later.
In other games played on Saturday, Espanyol followed up their midweek UEFA Cup victory by winning 5-1 at home to first division new boys Extremadura, a side without a single point in five games.
The newcomers have conceded 15 goals while scoring only twice.
Athletic Bilbao came from behind to win 2-1 at Racing Santander, while Real Sociedad lost ground on the leaders in a goalless draw at home to Valladolid.
